channel.title: University/colleges
channel.description: Moparscape users who are currently in or graduated from college... Mind posting which schools you have gone? I am in a college decision process and I would like to know which schools you have gone to? I don't mind if u post ur stats like(gpa,ecs,sat/act) Just out of curiosity. I don't expect Ivy League grads but just some nice wholesome exp abt the university u went to (Undergrad exp perferrably(you know.. Social and campus life...courses are they.... Rigorous))

item.title: University/colleges
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:34, topic:527557”]Uchicago and Purdue are also realllllly hard to get in
I would rank them close to Ivy League status. You have chance with a 33 but
Do you have rewards and recognition (like Olympiad crap)
My school is small and I may be able (if lucky) I could hold saludatorian or vale
Status in my school. My ec is kinda weak, like I am in robotics 9-11 I edit videos and photos for robotics as well. I am key club founder and pres in my school. Soccer in 10th and little in 11th. I’m planning to track and field in 12th. I also have 110 hours last week at the library. I also have 2 or 3 hours at food bank. I’m planning to get a 2100+ this time on sat I hope
As that’s all I have been doing. And in act I hope I get 30+
I am also taking sat ii
I also do anime club but I doubt it hardly counts.
You have a pretty good transcript and wish you the best
(You are probably not Asian and would have. A better chance than me if you applied) since your.overall academics are good.[/quote]
I know tons of kids that go to Purdue from my school and we have programs here in Engineering through Purdue that I have taken so I’m really not all that worried about getting into
Purdue. UChicago has sent me a shirt, probably about 20 fliers, and at least 5 letters, so I figured they will accept me there based on how much mail I am getting. But I really don’t know too much about college admissions so maybe UChicago won’t admit me but if they sent me a free shirt I figure they want me. Seems like a lot of effort just to decline someone to me.

chillwitm888:

Do you have rewards and recognition (like Olympiad crap)

Our school doesn’t participate in the Math Olympiad or anything like that. The only awards that I have received are awards given by the school. I pretty much have gotten all of the science and math awards, but I’m not sure what all that is worth.

chillwitm888:

My school is small and I may be able (if lucky) I could hold saludatorian or vale

I am currently salutatorian at my school, but that might change. I took two study halls this year to focus on my education so that school didn’t get in the way of it. So I might get passed up, I might not.

chillwitm888:

You have a pretty good transcript and wish you the best

Thanks man. I wish you the best too. Never been more anxious in my life to be honest.

Read full topic

item.title: University/colleges
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:22, topic:527557”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=646312.msg4347369#msg4347369 date=1376083768]
I know this is meant for graduates and whatnot, but maybe I can add to the conversation somewhat as I’m going through the college decision process. I scored a 33 on the ACT. Nothing all that great that will set me apart. I joke around and say I’m illiterate since English is my weak side. I really would absolutely love to go to MIT and am working on a portfolio with some ideas that I have been working on. I’m more of an introvert so I don’t really care about the social aspect of college that much. Personally the only goals I want is to get away from the small town I live in, do something with my life, and be surrounded by people that make me feel stupid rather than hicks. To me it is all about the rankings and prestige of the university. And the price of course, but I am eligible for a lot of financial aid so usually it is ok. I also would prefer courses to be rigorous as in no busy work but a few problems that may take your five friends 2 hours to solve or something.

What are you looking for in a college chill? Universities come is all sorts of shapes and sizes haha.
[/quote]
33 is a very good score! What is your breakdown? I am not great with English my self as I am a abc. MIT is my favorite university but its wayyyyyy too hard to get in. One can get into Harvard but not MIT.
I am looking forward to JHU and CMU also Cornell. Swarthmore is also in consideration
But of course I do have some SUNY schools as safety as I am residing ny resident.
You can get 4.0 weighted gpa ranked top 1% gpa and perfect act or sats
And easily rejected.
I know from previous valedictorians in my district.
Do you have special ecs? Like sports clubs vol, etc[/quote]
I got a 30 in English, a 35 in Math, a 36 in Science, a 30 in Critical Reading, and an 8 in Writing.

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:22, topic:527557”]You can get 4.0 weighted gpa ranked top 1% gpa and perfect act or sats And easily rejected.[/quote] Yeah I know, there’s no “secret formula” to get into MIT haha. Harvard recently started a financial aid program in 08 or something that I was unaware of so I am probably going to be applying there too.

chillwitm888:

But of course I do have some SUNY schools as safety as I am residing ny resident.

That’s pretty much my plan too. I’m shooting high but I have a safety net just in case haha. I plan on applying to UChicago because they’ve been pestering me just about every week, are close to where I live, and are a really good school to boot. And just in case I don’t get accepted there I’ll just go to Purdue.

chillwitm888:

Do you have special ecs? Like sports clubs vol, etc

Yeah, but not a lot. I played/am playing football my freshman through senior year and lettered varsity my junior and senior year. I am in German club. I have a few hours of volunteer work haha. I’m probably going to join Nation Honors Society this year too. Only thing I am probably worried about is community service crap. Hopefully college’s won’t worry that much haha.

Read full topic

item.title: University/colleges
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:31, topic:527557”][quote author=Whackatre link=topic=646312.msg4347551#msg4347551 date=1376105218]

wait so you believe him?

No…?
[/quote]
What I really meant was, why would you come to program runescape private servers and troll on these forums when you have a masters In C.S at columbia.
I have visited the campus, and the people there are really quiet and really mature and welcome.
And
No the ivy league maturity is not utterly ridiculous. IT ISN’T like its a freaking myth. Just accept MOST people there are mature.
I am definitely not implying they are all mature. But they are mature enough to focus onto what needs to be done.
That’s how they freaking get in the first place.
I have ivy league childhood friends and they are all either very quiet or very friendly and sociable.
And also only the arrogant and superficial ivys are immature (which i agree are quite some number but overall not too many)[/quote]Maturity… that thing you pretend to have when you’re 15. Also the time when you think you’re a big shot because you can capitalise your sentences properly.

Read full topic

Age: 14
Experience(In Years.): 2-3
Your top 3 best skills: Im Very good in Website design and good coder and a great player/staff overall :)!
How can you help us: I can help with site and code A bit and help players all i can! I can also start Advertising Servers and make the offical Trailor for your server and i can advertise server on Multiple Website including Moparscape and hell if you need a host i can host. And i will Start Donating a bit to Improve the Server once i join the Team! :)!
Do you think you’ve got what it takes: Yes, i had a server of my own once!
Email?: Shane9000100@hotmail.com

Posituation?: Website Designer or Tester!
[/quote][/quote]

item.title: University/colleges
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:5, topic:527557”]@java I couldn’t find griffin but is Gordon junior college just Gordon college?
Clayton seems pretty okay, is the env crowded or quiet?
Btw when after oct when I take my sat, and I post my stats do u mind chancing me? Some schools I’m considering is Carnegie m. And Jhu. I also got to have a higher gpa… Hopefully this year[/quote]

Yeah it goes by that a lot these days.(Gordon College I mean) The general academic classes averaged about 15-25 people per class. The actual specialty classes were less more like 10-20. I stayed in the dorms so it was always nice there. Good food too for what it’s worth. Depending on your gpa/sat scores most universities will require you to take a “compass” type test at their school anyway so it really doesn’t matter. I took one at Griffin Technical College and it said I qualified for all of their academic classes etc. When i went to Clayton I took theirs and it said I flunk their science portion. Good thing for me though was I wasn’t required to take any for my major(s).

If you want more information on the campus etc though feel free to skype me : eddieconnerrsps

[hr]

Wow, you must live really close to me.

Probably, Griffin, GA is like in the South Atlanta ish area. North of Macon, out there around PeachTree, fayetteville, and etc. Skype me maybe we could meet up for beers or something if you are legal lol : eddieconnerrsps

Read full topic

item.title: University/colleges
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

My Gpa is around a 3.4, I can raise it just about a 4.5w since i have a rigorous senior course load (if i get atleast 90+ in everything) (if i do… ill get placed back to number 1)
i am ranked around top 8% atm and first graduating class… you really have to improve your class rank, or else there is no chance of you getting in to CMU 10% if your lucky… Do you have any special Extra curriculars or any at all? mind mentioning some?
Class rank is very important, your sat is at like 50th percentile and CMU i believe
You should see Cooper union, its freakin awesome!! (but impossible to get in but best C.S major )

Read full topic
